phrases.phrase: What have you been up to?
It was nice seeing you again.
I look forward to seeing you again
See you later! Or- See you soon!
I’m out. Or- I’m out of here.
phrases.translation: (Me voy. O – Me voy de aquí.)

phrases.phrase: This is ______. He/She is my co-worker.
phrases.translation: (Este/a es ______. Él/Ella es mi compañero/a de trabajo.)

phrases.phrase: I’d like to introduce you to _______, the _______at ________.
I would like you to meet ________.

phrases.translation: (- ¡Hola! Soy Elizabeth, la prima de Eric.)

phrases.phrase: Hey, I’m Betsy. I’m the new project manager.
phrases.translation: (- Hey, soy Betsy. Soy la nueva gerente delproyecto.)

phrases.phrase: This is Carl. He is our new IT manager.
phrases.translation: (- Este es Carl. Él es nuestro nuevo gerente en TIC.)

phrases.phrase: I’d like you to meet Anna. She has been a friend of mine for ten years.
phrases.translation: (- Me gustaría que conocieras a Anna. Ella ha sido mi amiga por 10 años.)

phrases.phrase: I like to read books by Dr. Seuss.
phrases.translation: (- Me gusta leer los libros del Dr. Seuss.)

phrases.phrase: Peter enjoys running in the snow
phrases.translation: (- Peter disfruta correr en la nieve.)

phrases.phrase: I enjoy this peace and quiet.
I love eating sushi. It is so delicious.
phrases.translation: (- Amo comer sushi. Es muy rico.)

phrases.phrase: Bob really loves the new morning program on NBC.
phrases.translation: (- Bob de verdad ama el nuevo programa matutino en NBC.)

phrases.phrase: I really like taking long walks in on the beach.
phrases.translation: (- Me gusta mucho dar largos paseos en la playa.)

phrases.phrase: I adore Maria. She is such a nice girl.
phrases.translation: (- Adoro a María. Es una chica muy dulce.)

phrases.phrase: My favorite movie is Top Gun. It is full of action.
phrases.translation: (- Mi película favorita es “Top Gun”. Está repleta de acción.)

phrases.phrase: I don’t like to pick up after my kids.
phrases.translation: (No me gusta pasar por mis hijos.)

phrases.phrase: I don’t enjoy eating spicy food.
I don’t enjoy talking to my boss.
I hate crying babies. They give me a headache.
phrases.translation: (Odio a los bebés llorones. Me dan dolor de cabeza.)

phrases.phrase: My least favorite food is spinach.
phrases.translation: (Mi comida menos favorita es la espinaca.)

phrases.phrase: My least favorite season is winter.
phrases.translation: (Mi estación menos preferida es el invierno.)

phrases.phrase: What do you do for a living?
How do you spend most of your time?
phrases.translation: (¿Cómo pases la mayor parte de tu tiempo?)

phrases.phrase: I’m a stay at home mom
I am in between jobs right now.
phrases.translation: (Estoy en medio de puestos de trabajo ahora mismo.)

phrases.phrase: I’m a college student and work part-time as a bartender
phrases.translation: (Soy estudiante universitario y trabajo de bar ténder medio tiempo.)

phrases.phrase: I work in a paper factory.
I work in sales for a large telecommunications company.
phrases.translation: (Trabajo en ventas para una gran compañía de telecomunicaciones.)

phrases.phrase: I am talking on the phone.
I am learning to speak English.
I am chatting with my friends on Skype.
phrases.translation: (Estoy charlando con mis amigos vía Skype.)

type.name-type: Verbos más comunes utilizados para referirse al Pasado

phrases.phrase: I read two books over the weekend.

type.name-type: List of Common ‘Times’ in the Past
Las dos frases más comunes para referirse al futuro son
List of Common ‘Times’ in the Future

phrases.phrase: I will go on vacation in June.
phrases.translation: (Yo me iré de vacaciones en junio.)

phrases.phrase: I will meet with my friends on Friday.
phrases.translation: (Me encontraré con mis amigos el viernes.)

phrases.phrase: I will go shopping next week.
phrases.translation: (Iré de compras la semana que viene.))

phrases.phrase: Next year I am moving to Boston.
phrases.translation: (El año que viene, me mudaré a Boston.)

phrases.phrase: I am going to get married in a few years.
phrases.translation: (Voy a casarme en unos pocos años.)

phrases.phrase: When I retire I am going to travel a lot.
phrases.translation: (Cuando me retire, voy a viajar mucho.)

type.name-type: Wake up, go to sleep, brush your teeth, take a bath/shower, use the internet, cok, lean, drive, talk to a spouse/partner, study, read, etc

phrases.translation: Me despierto a las 7:00 a. m.

phrases.phrase: I work out four days a week.
phrases.translation: (Hago ejercicio cuatro días a la semana.)

phrases.phrase: I go to work every day.
I go to school five days a week.
phrases.translation: (oy al colegio cinco días a la semana.)

phrases.phrase: I brush my teeth every day.
phrases.translation: (Me cepillo los dientes todos los días.)

phrases.phrase: On Tuesdays and Thursdays, I go to English class.
phrases.translation: (Los martes y jueves, voy a clases de inglés.)

phrases.phrase: I take a shower every night.
II eat three times a day.
I go to Italy every summer
What do you like to do for fun?
What do you like to do in your free time?
phrases.translation: ¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?

type.name-type: Maneras comunes de responder a estas preguntas son:

phrases.phrase: I like _______ in my free time.
When I’m not working, I like to…
In my free time, I like to work out at the gym.
phrases.translation: En mi tiempo libre, me gusta entrenar en el gimnasio.

phrases.phrase: I like to spend time with my family and friends in my free time.
phrases.translation: (Me gusta pasar tiempo con mi familia y amigos en mi tiempo libre.)

phrases.phrase: I am learning to play the guitar.
When I’m not working, I like to run and play soccer.
phrases.translation: (Cuando no estoy trabajando, me gusta correr y jugar fútbol.)

phrases.phrase: I like to read novels in my free time.
phrases.translation: (Me gusta leer novelas en mi tiempo libre.)

phrases.phrase: I go to a cooking class every week.
phrases.translation: (Voy a clases de cocina cada semana.)

phrases.phrase: I am learning to knit. I not very good at it yet but I am getting better
phrases.translation: (Estoy aprendiendo a tejer. No soy muy bueno aún pero voy mejorando.)

type.name-type: Phrases To Talk about Your Family

phrases.phrase: There are ____ people in my family.
I live close to my family.
I live far away from my family.

type.name-type: Preguntas que puede hacerle a alguien acerca de su familia:

phrases.phrase: How many children do you have?
Do you have a large (or small) family?
Do you live near your extended family?
How many siblings do you have?
After a horrible break up and divorce, I am happy to be single again.
phrases.translation: (Después de un horrible rompimiento y divorcio, estoy feliz de estar soltero otra vez.)

phrases.phrase: We have been happily married for 10 years.
My brother is not in a relationship. He likes to hook up with random girls.
phrases.translation: (Mi hermano no está en una relación. A él le gusta tener sexo con chicas al azar.)

type.name-type: Preguntas para hacerle a alguien acerca de su relación

phrases.phrase: How long have you been married (together)?
Have you been friends for a long time?
How did you meet each other?
I don’t know how to cook _______.
I would like to learn to cook ________.
I only know how to cook ________ and ________.
My favorite food is spaghetti with meatballs.
phrases.translation: Mi comida favorita es espagueti con albóndigas.

phrases.phrase: My least favorite food is sushi.
phrases.translation: Mi comida menos favorita es el sushi.

phrases.phrase: I like to eat Chinese food.
I like to cook Mexican food. Spicy food is my favorite.
phrases.translation: Me gusta cocinar comida mexicana. La comida picante es mi favorita.

phrases.phrase: My mom cooks the best potato salad.
phrases.translation: Mi mamá cocina la mejor ensalada de papas.

type.name-type: Questions To Ask About Food and Cooking

phrases.phrase: What kind of food do you like?
What are you good at cooking?
Can you give me the recipe for this?
I hate ____ weather. (cold, hot, rainy, etc.)
I’m sick and tired of this weather
phrases.translation: Estoy enfermo y cansado de este clima.

type.name-type: Questions to Ask About the Weather

phrases.phrase: Is it going to ______? (rain, snow, be hot, be cold, storm, etc.)
phrases.translation: (¿Va a ______? (Llover, nevar, estar caliente, estar frío, haber una tormenta, etc.))

phrases.phrase: When will this weather ever end?
Is it supposed to _______ tomorrow? (rain, snow, be hot, etc.)
phrases.translation: ¿Se supone que va a _______ mañana? (llover, nevar, hacer calor, etc.)

phrases.phrase: I take the bus to _____ every day.
phrases.translation: (Tomo el bus para _____ todos los días.)

phrases.phrase: I rarely ________ to work. It is too far away
phrases.translation: (Raramente yo ________ al trabajo. Es muy lejos.)

phrases.phrase: I don’t take the ______. It does not have a reliable schedule.
phrases.translation: (Yo no tomo el ______. No tiene un horario confiable.)

phrases.phrase: I take the bus to work every day.
phrases.translation: Tomo el bus al trabajo todos los días.

phrases.phrase: My commute takes two hours. There is always a lot of traffic.
phrases.translation: Mi viaje diario toma dos horas. Siempre hay mucho tráfico.

phrases.phrase: I ride my bike to work.
We usually walk to stores. If we have to go far we drive in the car
phrases.translation: Usualmente, caminamos a las tiendas. Si tenemos que irnos lejos, manejamos en el carro.

phrases.phrase: How do you get to school?
How do you get to work?
Do you have a long/short commute?
Do you drive to work every day?
Where’s the closest bus stop to here?
phrases.translation: (¿Dónde está la parada de autobús más cercana?)

phrases.phrase: What time does the next _____ come? (bus, train, etc.)
phrases.translation: (¿A qué hora viene el siguiente _____? (bus, tren, etc.))

type.name-type: Questions You Can Ask about Time

phrases.phrase: What time do you go to school?
phrases.translation: ¿A qué hora vas a la escuela?

phrases.phrase: What time do you get out of school?
What time does the movie start?
What time does the class end?
When does the aerobics class meet?
phrases.translation: ¿A qué hora es la clase aeróbica?

phrases.phrase: The school is in between South Ave. and Birch Street.
phrases.translation: (La escuela está entre la Avenida Sur y la calle Birch)

phrases.phrase: Go straight for three blocks and then turn right. It is the third house from the corner
phrases.translation: (Vaya derecho por tres cuadras y luego cruce a la derecha. Es la tercera casa desde la esquina)

phrases.phrase: McDonalds is opposite Taco Bell in the food court at the mall.
phrases.translation: (McDonald’s está opuesto a Taco Bell en la corte de la comida en el centro comercial.)

phrases.phrase: I live close to West Tower on Broadway Ave.
phrases.translation: (Yo vivo cerca de West Tower en la Avenida Broadway.)

type.name-type: Questions Used to Ask for/Give Directions

phrases.phrase: Can you tell me how to get to _____?
Could you tell me where the _______ is?
How many days do you _____ a week? (work, go to school, study, etc.)
phrases.translation: (¿Cuántos días _____ a la semana? (Trabajas, vas a la escuela, estudias, etc.))

phrases.phrase: What year did you _______? (go to Brazil, move to New York, etc.)
phrases.translation: (¿En qué año _______? (fuiste a Brasil, te mudaste a Nueva York, etc.))

phrases.phrase: How many eggs are in a dozen?
How many students are in the class?
How many people went to the party?
How much does a box of cookies cost?
How much do I owe you?
How much do you make an hour?
How much did he pay you?
How much do you pay for car insurance?
phrases.translation: ¿Cuánto pagas por el seguro de coche?

phrases.phrase: My brother lives in the Philippines.
My brother lives in the Philippines.
My brother lives in the Philippines.
I would like a table for _____.
This is not what I ordered.
Could I have the bill please?
Can I get the check please?
Can I get a to-go box?
Can I get a take away box?
Can I get a doggy bag?
I am looking for _________. Can you tell me where to find it?
Do you have this in size ____?
MDo you have this in red/blue/black?

phrases.translation: (bigger, smaller, shorter, longer, etc.)(¿Tiene uno _____________? (más grande, más pequeño, más corto, más largo, etc.))

phrases.phrase: I would like to try these on.
I need to go to the doctor.
I have had an earache for the last week.
phrases.translation: (He tenido un dolor de oído por toda la semana.)

phrases.phrase: I have been dizzy for a few hours. I’m not sure why.
phrases.translation: (He estado mareado por algunas horas. No estoy seguro del por qué.)

phrases.phrase: There is a fire at __________________. (state location or address)
phrases.translation: (Hay un incendio en __________________. (indique el lugar o la dirección))

phrases.phrase: Someone has been hurt at _____________. (state location or address)
phrases.translation: (Alguien se ha lastimado en _____________. (indique el lugar o la dirección))

phrases.phrase: If I were you, I would __________.
Advice: You should put a sweater on.
Advice: Maybe you should take some medicine.
phrases.translation: Consejo: Tal vez deberías tomar algún medicamento.)

phrases.phrase: Advice: If I were you, I would go to the doctor.
phrases.translation: (Consejo: Si yo fuera tú, me iría al médico.)

phrases.phrase: Problem: I failed my math exam.
Advice: If I were you, I would ask the professor if you can take it again.
phrases.translation: (Consejo: Si yo fuera tú, le preguntaría al profesor si puedes tomarlo de nuevo.)

phrases.phrase: Do you want to go to the movies with me?
Would you like to go to the beach?
Can you please pick me up at 3pm?
Yes, I think that will work.

phrases.translation: (Lo siento, eso no va a funcionar porque ____________.)

phrases.phrase: I’d like to but I don’t have any money.
Sorry, that won’t work because I have class.
phrases.translation: (Lo siento, eso no va a funcionar porque tengo clase)

phrases.phrase: I have other plans on Saturday.
Would you like to ________ with me?
Would you like to go ____ on Saturday?
I’m going to ________. Do you want to come with?
Would you like to go out to dinner with me?
Would like to go shopping with me after class?
phrases.translation: (¿Te gustaría ir de compras conmigo después de clase?)

phrases.phrase: I’m going to the library. Do you want to come with?
Are you free on Sunday afternoon?.
phrases.translation: ¿Estás libre el domingo por la tarde?

phrases.phrase: I don’t think that will work out.
Let me check my calendar and get back to you.
phrases.translation: (Déjame chequear mi calendario y te contactaré.)

phrases.phrase: I’m a little under the weather.

type.name-type: Phrases to Help You Express Your Feelings

phrases.phrase: I don’t like it when it ________. It makes me feel ________.
phrases.translation: (No me gusta cuando _____________. Me hace sentir __________.)

title-phrases.phrases: Poniendose de acuerdo y en desacuerdo

type.name-type: The most common ways to agree

phrases.phrase: I love this weather. Respond: “Me too.”
phrases.translation: (Me encanta este clima. Responde: Yo también.)

phrases.phrase: I like chocolate cake. Respond: “Me too.”
phrases.translation: (Me gusta el pastel de chocolate. Responde: A mí también.)

phrases.phrase: I don’t like sea food. Respond: “Me neither.”
phrases.translation: (No me gusta la comida de mar. Responde: A mí tampoco.)

phrases.phrase: I haven’t ever been here before. Respond: “Me neither.”
phrases.translation: (Nunca no he estado aquí antes. Responde: Yo tampoco.)

phrases.phrase: “So do I” (Response to a simple positive statement)
phrases.translation: (También a mí (Respuesta a una declaración positiva sencilla))

phrases.phrase: “Neither do I” (Response to a simple negative statement)
phrases.translation: ( Tampoco a mí (Respuesta a una declaración negativa sencilla))

phrases.phrase: I love Mickey Mouse. Respond: “So do I.”
phrases.translation: (Me encanta Mickey Mouse. Responde: También a mí)

phrases.phrase: I don’t like spicy food. Respond: “Neither do I.”
phrases.translation: (No me gusta la comida picante. Responde: Tampoco a mí)

type.name-type: The most common ways to disagree

phrases.translation: (Me gusta la pizza. Respondo: A mí no.)

phrases.phrase: I love Justin Bieber. Respond: “I don’t.”
phrases.translation: (Me encanta Justin Bieber. Respondo: A mí no”.)

type.name-type: Sentence Starters to Talk about Similarities

phrases.phrase: Emily is similar to James. They both love to dance.
phrases.translation: (Emily es similar a James. Ambos aman bailar.)

type.name-type: Sentence Starters to Talk about Differences

phrases.phrase: The elephant is bigger than the mouse.
phrases.translation: (El elefante es más grande que el ratón.)

phrases.phrase: The BMW is more expensive than the Honda.
phrases.translation: (El BMW es más caro que el Honda.)

phrases.phrase: This shirt is nicer than that one.
If you want an honest opinion…

phrases.translation: (De la manera en que yo lo veo...)

phrases.phrase: I am of the opinion that…
As far as I understand it…
I think pizza is the best food ever
phrases.translation: (Creo que la pizza es el mejor alimento que he comido jamás.)

phrases.phrase: It seems to me that she doesn’t know what she is doing
phrases.translation: (Me parece que ella no sabe lo que está haciendo.)

phrases.phrase: In my experience, people are more productive in silence
phrases.translation: (En mi experiencia, las personas son más productivas en silencio.)

phrases.phrase: - I believe that he is one of the best actors.
phrases.translation: (Creo que él es uno de los mejores actores.)

phrases.phrase: I’d suggest we go to McDonalds instead of Burger King.
phrases.translation: (Te sugiero que vayamos a McDonald’s en lugar de Burger King)

phrases.phrase: I’m sorry to bother you but…
There seems to be a problem with…
Can you please help me with…
Could you please tell me why…
I’m sorry to say this but…
I hate to tell you but…
I’m sorry to bother you but I need more ketchup.
There seems to be a problem with my order. I didn’t get the right thing.
phrases.translation: (Parece que hay un problema con mi pedido. No me dieron lo correcto.)

phrases.phrase: I hate to tell you but this food is cold
phrases.translation: (Odio decirte esto, pero esta comida está fría.)

phrases.phrase: I’m not satisfied with the service. The waiter hasn’t been to our - table in more than 20 minutes.
phrases.translation: (No estoy satisfecho con el servicio. El camarero no ha venido a nuestra mesa en más de 20 minutos)

phrases.phrase: Would you please wake me up at 7am?
Could you please carry my suitcase? It’s really heavy.
phrases.translation: (¿Podrías llevar mi maleta? Es muy pesada.)

phrases.phrase: Could you please fill out this form?
phrases.translation: (¿Podría usted por favor, rellenar este formulario?)

phrases.phrase: Would you please bring us two cups of coffee with sugar?
phrases.translation: (¿Podrías traernos dos tazas de café con azúcar?)

phrases.phrase: Could you please tell me your name again? I seem to have forgotten it.
phrases.translation: (¿Podrías por favor decirme tu nombre? Me parece que lo olvidé.)

phrases.phrase: Would you please call Mr. Peterson and tell him I am running late?
phrases.translation: (¿Podrías por favor llamar al Sr. Peterson y decirle que voy a llegar tarde?)

phrases.phrase: Can you please give me another drink?
Could you please say that again?
phrases.translation: (¿Podrías por favor decir eso de nuevo?)

phrases.phrase: Would you mind closing the door? It’s really loud out there.
phrases.translation: (¿Te Importaría cerrar la puerta? Está muy ruidoso allá afuera.)

phrases.phrase: Would you mind telling me where you bought this salad? It’s delicious.
phrases.translation: (¿Te Importaría decirme donde compraste esta ensalada? Está deliciosa.)

phrases.phrase: Would you mind turning down the music? I can’t hear you.
phrases.translation: (¿Te Importaría bajarle a la música? No puedo escucharte.)

phrases.phrase: Would you mind if I used your phone really quickly? I have to call my grandmother.
phrases.translation: (¿Te Importa si uso tu teléfono rápido? Tengo que llamar a mi abuela.)
